dmca.title: [ABUSE] DMCA Take down notice
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Monday, December 12, 2005 2:24 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com; ken@EnvironmentalChemistry.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] DMCA Take down notice]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] DMCA Take down notice
Date: Sat, 10 Dec 2005 15:51:02 -0500
From: Kenneth Barbalace <ken@EnvironmentalChemistry.com>
Organization: EnvironmentalChemistry.com
To: legal-response@theplanet.com
CC: abuse@theplanet.com

Dear Legal Team ThePlanet.com

I have a good faith belief that the webpage http://www.our-shared-
environment.net/phpnuke/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=30 that
housed on a website that is hosted by your servers is an unauthorized copy
of my webpage
http://environmentalchemistry.com/yogi/environmental/wastehistory.html.
 You
will notice that not only was the content of the page copied from my
website, but that the webpage's source code still contains references to my
Amazon.com affiliate links.

You will also note that my copyright claims are clearly stated at the bottom
of each of my webpages and within the source code of my pages in an effort
to clearly mark that my content is not in the public domain. In addition no
request was ever made nor was permission ever granted for the article in
question to be republished in any format.

As this webpage is an unauthorized copy of my copyrighted works, I am
requesting that the webpage in question be removed from your servers
immediately and that the offending party does not in the future make any
attempts to redistribute any of my copyrighted content.

This is not the first time that I have run into issues with this site
copying materials from my website and I have had to file DMCA take down
notices for this site in the past when it was housed on other servers.

I did try to contact the site directly; however, there is no means of
contacting responsible parties on the website itself.

Any and all questions regarding this copyright infringement claim should be
directed to:
  Kenneth Barbalace
  Editor in Chief EnvironmentalChemistry.com
  326 Auburn ST #10, Portland Maine 04103
  Phone: 207-797-8202
  Fax: 207-899-2396

Under penalty of perjury, I certify that the information I have provided is
accurate as of this date, December 10, 2005.  I also certify that as the
exclusive copyright holder for EnvironmentalChemistry.com and the content on
said website I am authorized to make any and all copyright claims in regards
to content that was inappropriately copied from said website.

Failure to remove the offending webpage from your servers will result in
legal actions against your company and the website's owner under the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act which can result in fines of $150,000 per
infraction.

As this is not the first time I have had to file a DMCA take down notice on
this site I will be having my lawyers begin to the appropriate legal
proceedings to file claim under the DMCA for damages and a permanent
injunction if the offending article is not removed from the website in
question post haste.

Sincerely,
Kenneth Lea Barbalace
Editor in Chief EnvironmentalChemistry.com



- -------
EnvironmentalChemistry.com
Chemistry, Environmental and Hazardous Materials Transportation Resources:
        http://EnvironmentalChemistry.com/



- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
